title._content: ["Darena," George Barton French house, Southampton, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Darena," George Barton French house, Southampton, New York. Flower garden] [1913] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site history. In 1914 George Barton French acquired the house from John B. Cauldwell, director of the Fine Arts of the United States Commission to the Paris Exposition of 1900. On slide (handwritten): "F" and "French, G.B., Southampton." Also, blue star sticker, gold star sticker, and blue penciled X. Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16872 Call Number: LC-J717-X109- 67
